abstract: Executives at NovaStar Financial, a subprime mortgage originator whose stock has dropped from $40 to $1.72, have pocketed millions in compensation.
snippet: Executives at NovaStar Financial, a subprime mortgage originator whose stock has dropped from $40 to $1.72, have pocketed millions in compensation.
lead_paragraph: THINGS aren’t going very swimmingly for investors in NovaStar Financial, a subprime mortgage originator in Kansas City, Mo. Its stock plummeted last week on news that the company lost $64.05 a share in the third quarter, that it had canceled its preferred stock dividend and that it was no longer able to reap the tax advantages of a real estate investment trust status.
